data.name: L’Olonnais Expedition
data.desc: L’Olonnais drifts towards Sp Hon, whereupon he sacks Puerto Caballos, attempts to sack San Pedro Sula, and attempts to sack a Sp galleon in Amatique Bay
data.locn: Tortuga, Batabanó [Cuba], Cape Gracias a Dios, Río Aguán [Sp Hon], Puerto Caballos, San Pedro Sula, Amatique Bay, Old, Abraham’s Caye
data.agents_nsp0: L’Olonnais, Mozes van Klijn 1 Ship 5 Craft 700 men inc Ma men
data.note:
Sep-Nov 1667 L’Olonnais 6 Vessels 350 men retreat to cayes north of Amatique Bay / 4 Maya traders 1 PA impressed off Hon or Sp Hon /v Bialuschewski G 245 /GUATEMALA,39,R.43,N.199
 Nov 1667-May 1668 L’Olonnais camps Abraham’s Caye, and trades with Maya fishermen there, and Maya traders from mainland, eg fm Tipuj, giving metal tools and raw iron for foodstuff / thereafter raid 2 Maya villages / Maya possibly engage raiders in one of these raids /v Bialuschewski G p 246 /GUATEMALA,22,R.1,N.11 /ANOM Marine 3JJ 282 no 10 /ESCRIBANIA,1092A, pieza 16 ff 9-17
 Possibly see Spring 1666 Amatique Bay. Juan de la Cruz and 3 companions captured by 30 Fr buccaneers in 3 lg boats, then carried to Abraham's Caye [= Bluefields, Nicaragua] and impressed by Capt L'Olonnais /v Marley P 1 2
 Possibly see 20 May 1668 Garate a Rey. Informa enemigo entro por Puerto Caballos, saqueo y quemo Sn Pedro [Sp Hon] /v Garcia P 2 95
